title: Environment Agency failed to visit serious pollution incidents, leaked files show
summary:
Environment Agency failed to visit serious pollution incidents, files show2 days ago Share Save Jonah Fisher Environment correspondent Share SaveGetty Images Serious pollution incidents are those which have an impact on the environment, people or property.
Documents and data shared with BBC News from inside England's much criticised environment watchdog show an agency struggling to monitor incidents of serious pollution.
An internal EA document from this year states that all potentially serious incidents should be attended by staff.
The data show that overall the agency went to just 13% of all the pollution incidents, serious and more limited, that were reported to it in 2024.
Jonah Fisher/BBC Ashley Smith from the campaign group Windrush Against Sewage Pollution (WASP) says its "virtually impossible" to get the Environment Agency to come out.

title: America's blame game over Canada's wildfire smoke misses the point, experts say
summary:
America's blame game over Canada's wildfire smoke misses the point, experts say2 days ago Share Save Nadine Yousif Senior Canada reporter Share SaveGetty Images Smoke from Canada's wildfires have drifted south to the US several times this summer, clouding the sky with an orange haze.
A study published in the Nature journal in September has revealed that smoke from Canada's wildfires has also had far-reaching, fatal consequences.
Wildfire smoke contains PM2.5 - a type of air pollution - that is known to trigger inflammation in the body.
He added the findings show wildfire smoke should be treated as a serious health issue, akin to breast cancer or prostate cancer.
Gallo Images/Orbital Horizon/Copernicus Sentinel Data 2025 Wildfire smoke can often travel thousands of miles.

title: Chicago’s Once-Disgusting River Just Hosted a Swimming Party
summary:
On Sunday, over 250 swimmers dove into the Chicago River for its first open water swim in almost a century.
“Swimming in the Chicago River may sound like a wild idea, but the river has come a long way from its industrial past,” claimed the Chicago River Swim website.
Reclaiming the river“The Chicago River Swim is a symbol of Chicago’s resilience and progress.
The Chicago River Swim was originally planned for 2024, but the city denied the organization’s permit request, citing safety concerns for the proposed route, and the swim ultimately took place in Lake Michigan.
According to the Chicago River Swim website, the river is the cleanest in its recorded history.

title: Archaeologists stunned after excavation reveals long-hidden city: 'This is mind-blowing'
summary:

title: Volvo’s next-gen hybrids will be American-made EREVs
summary:
As it struggles with declining sales and an uncertain regulatory environment, Volvo is hoping to realign its fortunes by overhauling its electric vehicle plans.
And a big part of that is a bet on hybrid technology — or more specifically, extended-range electric vehicles (EREV).
That said, Volvo’s design team still hasn’t decided what kind of car it will be.
But once that decision is made and the EREV goes into production, then Volvo’s South Carolina factor will be at capacity.
Update September 25th: Volvo’s goal is to boost the number of US-built vehicles sold to 50 percent.

title: This Black Fungus Turns Plastic Waste Into Edible Ingredients
summary:
They can live almost anywhere, have both medicinal and poisonous qualities, and are—as new research suggests—capable of transforming industrial waste into useful compounds.
Engineers with the German startup Biophelion have successfully developed a method to coax a yeast-like black fungus—Aureobasidium pullulans—into decomposing and converting plastic waste into new products.
What’s more, during this process, the fungus consumes leftover carbon dioxide in plastic waste, using it to fuel itself and prevent the greenhouse gas from escaping into the atmosphere.
The method as is already offers a tantalizing solution for mass-produced plastic waste, however.
The surfactant molecule in particular could be the ideal replacement for artificial surfactants—mass-produced chemicals in laundry detergents and dish soap—that too often pollute the environment.

Over the next few months he noticed more posts on social media by politicians and their children - pictures showing exotic holidays, mansions, supercars and designer handbags.
The impact is especially pronounced among Filipinos, who are among the world's most active social media users, she adds.

title: Nvidia is letting anyone use its AI voice animation tech
summary:
is a news writer who covers the streaming wars, consumer tech, crypto, social media, and much more.
Nvidia is open-sourcing Audio2Face, its AI-powered tool that generates realistic facial animations for 3D avatars — all based on audio input.
The change means developers can now use the tool and its underlying framework to create realistic 3D characters for their games and apps.
The company notes that developers can use the tool to create 3D characters for pre-scripted content, as well as for livestreams.
In addition to open sourcing the Audio2Face models and software development kits, Nvidia is making the tool’s training frame available, allowing users to tweak its models for different use cases.

title: I’ve got a bone to pick with ‘getting credit’ from your fitness tracker
summary:
I’ll be the first person to admit that fitness trackers can be helpful tools.
Fitness trackers are tools meant to help you measure progress as you work toward health goals.
In recent years, fitness trackers have added scores to make disparate data points more digestible.
I’ve yet to meet a fitness tracking devotee who hasn’t gotten a little too obsessed with metrics at one point or another.
But for everyone else, I highly recommend taking a planned, 48 to 72-hour fitness tracking break every 90 days or so.
